elements.title: Data and code for the publication entitled: tree growth and mortality of 42 timber species in Central Africa (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
elements.contents:

Introduction This archive contains all the necessary data and R script to reproduce the results of the manuscript entitled "tree growth and mortality of 42 timber species in Central Africa" submitted to Forest Ecology and Management journal. It includes cleansed data (text files...

elements.title: Data from: Multifunctional soil recovery in the restoration of Brazil’s Atlantic Forest after bauxite mining (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

This data displays soil physical and chemical properties and microbial parameters including NGS data describing the diversity of bacterial communities. The study was conducted in 2013 in the private reserve of Retiro Branco and Córrego do Meio farm, in the municipality of Poços d...

elements.title: undefined (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
elements.contents:
UMR Eco&Sols(CIRAD-Centre de coopération internationale en recherche agronomique pour le développement)
Nov 12, 2021
Eco&Sols est une unité mixte de recherche de 70 permanents associant l’INRA, l’IRD, Montpellier SupAgro et le Cirad. Les travaux conduits à Eco&Sols ont pour objectif d’améliorer la compréhension du rôle des organismes du sol et des plantes, ainsi que des interactions entre eux e...

This dataset presents data obtained from manual and automatic extraction of partial n-Ary relations encountered in table forms. The tables were obtained from on documents available on the Science Direct website. The data are related to permeability n-Ary relations, as defined in...

elements.title: Risque de ruissellement selon des pentes à 7% sur l'île de La Réunion (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

Estimation d'un risque de ruissellement vers les cours d'eau du Domaine Public Fluvial de l'île de La Réunion selon des pentes supérieures ou égales à 7%. Le calcul de risque de ruissellement est effectué de manière itérative, en partant des cours d'eau et en progressant le long...

elements.title: Tree species inventory in the Cordyla pinnata parkland of Senegal (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

The tree inventory was conducted in the Cordyla pinnata parkland in Senegal, in the region of Nioro du Rip. A field campaign for tree species data collection was carried out in February 2019. It is a weighted stratified sampling of 213 observation sites distributed according to a...

This dataset provide data for calibration and evaluation of the model Stics in the specific context of malagasy higlands with rice cultivar Nerica 4. Data include soil moisture and N initialization, fertilization applied (quality and quantity), cropping practices, data on rice bi...

This dataset present the compilation of 72 scientific articles dealing with the use of covers in rubber tree plantations. These articles were selected following a review of litterature performed with the Web of Science, CAB abstract, Google Scholar, and some personnal communicati...

elements.title: Norway on Film AW21 (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Norway on Film AW21 The road may be long, the terrain may be tough but the results are spectacular. Shot the old fashioned way for a place where time stands still.

elements.title: A Mont-Blanc Gravel Tour with Etienne Hubert. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

A Mont-Blanc Gravel Tour with Etienne Hubert. After the last few months of training and the Olympics in Japan, I find myself constantly craving nature. I’ve thought about doing a Gravel tour of Mont Blanc for so long, so this seemed like the perfect time.

elements.title: Atelier Lookbook AW21. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Atelier Lookbook AW21. Uniquely styled, the collection mirrors the freedom of the road within the design and development process itself. Fewer rules, less restriction, more freedom.

elements.title: I am not a number 38. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
FILMS

I am not a number 38. As an Olympic sailor, Haffi understands the pressure that comes with competing at the highest level but for him, nothing compares to the intensity of racing on two wheels.

elements.title: AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook Outdoors is out there. Before and after the bike, between and among the hills. New Arrière-Pays pieces for AW21 inspired by the back country around Nice.

elements.title: Badlands: The Ultra Distance Gravel Race. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

Badlands: The Ultra Distance Gravel Race. Sophie Gateau tackles Badlands, an unsupported off-road race through Andalusia, made up of around 725km and 15,000m of altitude gain.

elements.title: Ride of the Month: October. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: October. In October 2020, Storm Alex hit the valleys in the hinterland around Nice and the whole landscape was permanently altered. Chris returns one year later.

elements.title: Tracks and Trails in the Ariège. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

Tracks and Trails in the Ariège. Five friends explore routes shared with the incredibly diverse range of four legged and airborne residents of the Ariège by bike.

elements.title: Guillaume Néry: A Traverse Across the Pyrenees (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Guillaume Néry: A Traverse Across the Pyrenees Each summer, I set off on an adventurous trip with good friends who are up for a challenge. Last year, we bikepacked through the Alps and this year we tackled the Pyrenees.

elements.title: Roc d'Azur: The CDC Gravel Team. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

Roc d'Azur: The CDC Gravel Team. At Café du Cycliste we really like gravel and so we have formed the ‘True Grit’ Café du Cycliste team. Three fierce female riders, Holly, Charlotte and Maria, take on one of the greatest gravel events in the world.

elements.title: I am not a number 06. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
FILMS

I am not a number 06. Alexia is the 10th woman in the world among nearly 100 skippers to have finished the Vendée Globe race without stopping and without assistance. Cycling is her other passion.

elements.title: The Best Tortilla in the World (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA VIE

The Best Tortilla in the World is found at the end of a hard day spent riding with friends on ancient Galician roads.

elements.title: The Los Padres Traverse Route and Long Traverse Film (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
The Los Padres Traverse Route and Long Traverse Film

The Los Padres Traverse route is not only an incredible ride, but it highlights the intersection of recreation, conservation, and climate. Watch The Long Traverse Film that highlights the route and story of these lands.

Read More
News, Reports, VideosDave MalwitzNovember 28, 2021stilspoke, gravel route, specialized, video, bikepacking, route, routes 0 Comments

elements.title: Roka Lockhart Sunglass For Gravel (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
Roka Lockhart Sunglass For Gravel

We don’t often feature sunglasses on the site but some recent products from ROKA Sports out of Austin Texas have seriously impressed. Our new favorite is the Lockhart that is a great daily sunglass that works just as well on the bike as it does off.

Read More
NewsDave MalwitzNovember 17, 2021roka, sunglasses 0 Comments

elements.title: This New Steel Flat Bar Gravel Bike We Definitely Want (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
This New Steel Flat Bar Gravel Bike We Definitely Want

This just in, State Bicycle revealed the latest gravel bike in their lineup, the 4130 Flat Bar. A slight variation on the State 4130 All Road, now with a Black Label Riser Bar for extra fun when the drops aren’t needed.

Read More
NewsDave MalwitzNovember 17, 2021state bicycle, flat bar gravel bike 0 Comments

elements.title: Film: Cycle of Ancestry (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
Film: Cycle of Ancestry

“Cycle of Ancestry" is a film about Mario Ordoñez-Calderón, a first-generation Mayan American who bikepacks 1,500 miles through the Yucatan Peninsula to explore his cultural heritage and learn about how your roots can shape your future.

Read More
VideosDave MalwitzNovember 8, 2021cycle of ancestry, bikepacking 0 Comments

elements.title: When Great Beer Does Good (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
When Great Beer Does Good

We check in with 10 Barrel Brewing and their recent efforts towards protecting the outdoor spaces we love. A portion of every purchase of Nature Calls IPA and Hazy Trail IPA goes toward supporting the Conservation Alliance and The Outdoor Alliance respectively.

Read More
NewsDave MalwitzOctober 21, 2021beer, 10 barrel brewing 0 Comments

elements.title: Film: Tears of Joy - Pachamama at Unbound Gravel (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
Film: Tears of Joy - Pachamama at Unbound Gravel

At this point, most people know the lasting impression that gravel cycling has. Under a gravel mindset, we seek to have fun, discover new and incredible places, lose ourselves and find ourselves. But is there a place for pure competition in this very experiential and burgeoning discipline? The folks of Emporia show us that there is, and teach us how to blend gravel around a local community.

Read More
VideosDave MalwitzOctober 21, 2021orbea 0 Comments

elements.title: Redshift Kitchen Sink Handlebar Long Term Review (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
Redshift Kitchen Sink Handlebar Long Term Review

Jason Rowland shares his long-term impressions on the latest gravel cycling gear from Redshift Sports. This story includes a Redshift Kitchen Sink Handlebar Review, a Redshift Really Long Bar Tape Review, and a ShockStop Stem Review by Jason, who tested the equipment on his OTSO Waheela C gravel bike while exploring the most demanding North American terrain from Alaska to Kansas.

Read More
ReportsDave MalwitzOctober 20, 2021redshift, review, gravel handlebar, otso 2 Comments

elements.title: Film: The Great Escape - Bikepacking UK (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
Film: The Great Escape - Bikepacking UK

In this inspiring film presented by Knog, British Adventurer Aaron Rolph reimagines the popular Land's End to John o'Groats traverse across Great Britain (typically 1,400km in length). Taking anything but the shortest route, Rolph brings to life a lockdown daydream, bikepacking 2,700km from the Scilly Isles to the Northernmost point of the Shetland Islands.

Read More
VideosDave MalwitzOctober 12, 2021bikepacking, video, united kingdom 1 Comment

elements.title: Film: Forgotten Roads Episode 1 - Big Sur (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
elements.contents:
Film: Forgotten Roads Episode 1 - Big Sur

Forgotten Roads is a 3 part series by Safa Brian and Alex Colorito. In each episode the two document a gravel ride in different parts of Southern California. They do this self-supported, carrying all their film gear, in the hopes of inspiring others to explore the world by bike. For the first episode they travel to Big Sur and tackle some seriously steep gradients in search of a Ridge Road that has been closed to cars since a storm hit a year ago.

Read More
VideosDave MalwitzSeptember 28, 2021safa brian, big sur, video, hammerhead 0 Comments
